para.text: dialog box. It is used to specify Generalized Flow boundaries in SUTRA 3.0.
combobox is used to select a
and a table where the boundary condition values are defined. The user can select
time schedule, the user can specify any time in the boundary condition table. Otherwise, only times defined in the
defines when the boundary condition changes.
turns the boundary condition on or off.
Pressure value at the first of two points that define the linear relation between fluid inflow/outflow and pressure at node IPBG. [M/(L∙s2)].
Rate of inflow/outflow of fluid mass when the computed pressure equals PBG1 at node IPBG. [M/s].
Pressure value at the second of two points that define the linear relation between fluid inflow/outflow and pressure at node IPBG. [M/(L∙s2)].
Rate of inflow/outflow of fluid mass when the computed pressure equals PBG2 at node IPBG. [M/s].

Determines whether a limit is set on fluid inflow/outflow, pressure, or neither at the first of two points that define the linear relation between fluid inflow/outflow and pressure at node IPBC. [M/(L∙s2)].
Determines whether a limit is set on fluid inflow/outflow, pressure, or neither at the second of two points that define the linear relation between fluid inflow/outflow and pressure at node IPBC.
Temperature or solute concentration of any external fluid that enters the model at node IPBC. UPBGI is a specified constant value. [°C] or [Ms/M].

specifies whether Outflow U is an absolute value or a difference in value relative to the concentration at the nodel. Indicates whether the temperature or solute concentration, UPBGO, of any fluid that exits the model at node IPBG is being specified directly (‘DIR’) or relative to the computed concentration or temperature at the node (‘REL’)

Temperature or solute concentration of any fluid that exits the model at node IPBG. If CUPBGO = ’DIR’, the exit temperature or concentration is set directly to the value UPBGO. If CUPBGO = ’REL’, the exit temperature or concentration is set to the value U+UBPGO, where U is the temperature or concentration computed at the node. [°C] or [Ms/M].
For more information on the Generalized Flow boundary condition, see the SUTRA 3.0 documentation.
